DataElement.preferredName: Radiation Therapy Boost Administration Timepoint Name
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Identification of the timepoint in reference to other treatment(s) in which an irradiation boost is administered.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation._Boost; increase or raise._Performing or possessing executive duties; acting as a supervisor or manager._A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event.

Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.:Boost; increase or raise.

A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).
